TopicTitle: Project Luna (put an artificial sattelite around every moon in KSP)

Articles.Content:
Still in progress, but I have managed to put orbiters around 4 moons already:

Mun:

Minmus:

Ike:

Gilly (With a landing since its basically just an asteroid):

To be continued...

Edited June 7, 2014 by TheSandDuna

If you really want to go all out use the SCANsat mod to actually map the moons. This also adds the need to go for a polar orbit. I'm on the same mission as you! I only have the Mun and Minmus at the moment though. Best of luck!

I second Col. Kurtz here. I send Scansat probes to all the moons and planets I entend to send a lander to (manned or not). So far, I'm only missing Jool's moons. But with a ion engine, it should be possible to map them all with just 1 probe.

- - - Updated - - -

But with a ion engine, it should be possible to map them all with just 1 probe.

You have no idea what you have just started...

- - - Updated - - -

You have no idea what you have just started...

But I'd love to know.

And I currently have a transfer stage on its way to Jool, carrying 5 small ion probes to be deployed in the Jool system, 1 for each moon.

Because even though the job can be done with just 1, I'd like to have probes around all of them.
